data.title: Hours and Pricing
data.text:
Parking at the Zoo costs $12 per vehicle for General Admission guests when purchased in advance. Parking passes purchased at entry are $15. Parking is free for Oakland Zoo Members.

We encourage General Admission guests to purchase parking online, in advance, while purchasing admission tickets.

If you purchased daytime admission tickets without parking, and would like to purchase a parking pass in advance, please visit our parking only webstore.

Upon arrival, General Admission guests will be asked to present their pre-purchased parking ticket. If you do not have a parking ticket when you arrive, you will be asked to purchase one prior to entry.

We encourage our guests to alleviate traffic and parking challenges around the Zoo by taking public transportation or ride-share services.

Dining

Oakland Zoo features a variety ofÂ diningÂ opportunities for the entire family. In addition to the food options inside the Zoo, visitors are welcome to use the picnic tables and benches, or sprawl out in the meadow. Outside alcohol is not permitted to be brought the zoo.Â For the safety of the animals, the Zoo does not provide straws.

Measure Y Oakland Resident Discount

Oakland residents receive a 25% discount on adult tickets, with an additional 15% off for child tickets and 10% off for senior tickets, made possible by Measure Y. Thank you for your support!

To receive this discount, use the âReserve and Buy Ticketsâ button under General Admission for Nonmembers on our Tickets page and select Oakland Resident Discount Tickets. Proof of residency is required at entry, see the webstore for additional details & restrictions.

There is no Oakland Resident Discount on memberships or special events.

Teacher Discount

Teachers* receive a 15% discount on daytime admission to the Zoo for themselves and one guest per visit. To receive this discount, tickets must be purchased online, in advance. Use the âReserve & Buy Ticketsâ button under General Admission for Nonmembers on our Tickets page and select Teacher Discount.

*Teachers of TK-12 students only. Teachers can be from any U.S. state or region, and must present proof of current employment (e.g., teacher staff ID card, verification from school administrator on official letterhead, recent paystub).

Military/Veteran Discount

In honor of their service, Oakland Zoo is pleased to offer active-duty military personnel, spouses of active-duty military personnel, and veterans a discount on daytime admission.

To receive this discount, use the âReserve and Buy Ticketsâ button under General Admission for Nonmembers on our Tickets page and select Military & Veteran Discount Tickets. Proof of active duty or veteran status required at entry, see the webstore for additional details and restrictions.

There is no Military/Veteran discount on memberships or special events.

Reciprocal Member Benefits

Oakland Zoo participates in the AZAÂ reciprocal membership program, giving 50% off daytime admission to members of partner organizations including San Francisco Zoo, Happy Hollow Zoo, CuriOdyssey, and Lindsay Wildlife Experience. For a full list of partners, please see our Reciprocity List.

To receive the discount, use the âReserve and Buy Ticketsâ button under General Admission for Nonmembers on our Tickets page and select Reciprocal Member Tickets. Proof of active membership at your home zoo/aquarium required at entry, see the webstore for additional details and restrictions.

There are no reciprocal benefits for Oakland Zoo memberships or special events.

Mobile Zoo App

Oakland Zoo's app features an interactive map, event news, planning info, and more. Download our app forÂ AppleÂ orÂ Android.

Service Dogs are Permitted

Individuals with disabilities may bring their service dogs to the Zoo. Download ourÂ Service Dog PolicyÂ for more information and a Service Dog Map to better understand where service dogs are allowed within the zoo.

Other Pets are Not Allowed

Dogs or other pets are not allowed on Zoo grounds or in parking areas.
